SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Checkout Page

The Checkout page provides a workflow—either standard checkout or line-level independence (LLI) checkout—for a buyer to place an order. The Checkout page consists of multiple sections, which you can configure independently. You can specify which information you allow a buyer to see and manage, including addresses, shipping options, and more. Many configuration options apply to both standard and LLI checkout, but some apply to only one workflow or the other.

REQUIRED EDITIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)
USER EXPERIENCE COMPATIBILITY
Interface	Bootstrap 3 or classic
User visibility	Logged-in users and guest users (depending on your storefront's guest user access)
NOTE
By default, B2B Commerce for Visualforce requires a guest buyer to register for a storefront account before they can check out. To allow a guest buyer to check out without registering for a storefront account, set up the appropriate Visualforce page, custom object, and Apex class permissions.
For LLI checkout, a guest user currently can only complete checkout in an org that hasn't completed the security alerts for preventing unauthorized guest user access. Because these security alerts are mandatory, guest checkout effectively isn't supported with LLI.
Enable Line-Level Independence (LLI) Checkout
The Checkout page for line-level independence (LLI) provides a workflow for a buyer to place an order with multiple shipping groups with unique shipping details. To enable this workflow, verify that your storefront user profile can access the required Visualforce page, and update your storefront configuration settings.
Specify the Source for Contact Information on the Checkout Page
You can specify whether the Contact Information section of the Checkout page autopopulates with details from the buyer's contact or user record. Or, you can specify that the Contact Information section doesn't autopopulate with any values.
Specify Whether a Buyer Can Modify Addresses on the Checkout Page
Control how much flexibility a buyer has when specifying a shipping and billing address on the Checkout page.
Show Name Fields for Addresses on the Checkout Page
When you allow a buyer to enter new address details during checkout, you can configure whether certain fields are available for the shipping or billing address.
Allow a Buyer to Specify a CC Email Address for Order Confirmation
When a buyer completes standard checkout, B2B Commerce sends an order confirmation email to the address specified in the User Information section of the Checkout page. You can allow a buyer to specify a CC email address that also receives a copy of the order confirmation email.
Specify Shipping Options for Standard Checkout
For standard checkout, you can show estimated shipping costs and allow a buyer to request a delivery date from the Shipping section of the Checkout page. You can also integrate data from an external shipping service provider.
Specify Shipping Group Options for LLI Checkout
When you enable line-level independence (LLI), a buyer can split an order by sorting items in the cart into multiple shipping groups. As admin, you can configure certain options for how a buyer sets up their shipping groups.
Set Up the Requested Delivery Date Picker on the Checkout Page
In either standard checkout or line-level independence (LLI) checkout, you can provide a date picker widget where a buyer can select a date for delivery. You can require a buyer to select a date, and you can validate the selected date, before the buyer is allowed to continue with checkout.
Set Up Terms and Conditions on the Checkout Page
Require a buyer to accept or acknowledge certain information before they can continue to the next checkout section. To manage the terms and conditions that you show to a buyer, edit records of the CC Terms custom object. You can also localize terms and conditions for an internationalized storefront.
Show Fees and Charges in the Order Review Section of the Checkout Page
Provide a summary of the buyer's total expected cost before they provide their payment information. In the Order Review section of the Checkout page, you can calculate and show shipping fees, taxes, or other miscellaneous surcharges.
Configure Payment Options Available on the Checkout Page
Provide an efficient and trusted interface for a buyer to specify their payment details during checkout. In the Payment section of the Checkout page, you can allow a buyer to manually enter payment information or select a stored payment option already defined.
Show Order Confirmation Details and Send Order Emails
After a buyer's payment successfully processes, B2B Commerce for Visualforce converts the cart to an order record. The Order Confirmation section of the Checkout page summarizes the cart, order, shipping, and billing details. You can also send a copy of the order confirmation to the email addresses specified in the Contact Information section of the Checkout page.
